categories.title: Rent
categories.comment: We spent a few months renting apartments and hotels in Turkey and Serbia. Now we pay €1,330 a month for the two-bedroom apartment in Helsinki.

categories.title: Mortgage
categories.comment: No mortgage, no cry.

categories.title: Utilities
categories.comment: We pay about €150/month for water, electricity and home internet here in Helsinki.

categories.title: Tax
categories.comment: Residence tax for three properties, which we sold last year.

categories.title: Repairs
categories.comment: No repairs for a year.

categories.title: Groceries
categories.comment: Groceries were balanced by the cheap food in Turkey, Serbia and pretty expensive here in Finland. We'll see the real cost next year.

categories.title: Eating out
categories.comment: More eating out, since we often lived in hotels.

categories.title: Alcohol
categories.comment: I blame Turkey's all-inclusive hotels for this :) I should go back on the sober track.

categories.title: Gas
categories.comment: We sold the Opel at the beginning of the year. Then became car-free.

categories.title: Maintenance
categories.comment: Oil change and some maintenance.

categories.title: Car Tax
categories.comment: Registration fees.

categories.title: Insurance
categories.comment: Basic insurance for a year.

categories.title: Parking
categories.comment: Underground parking lot for two months.

categories.title: Public transport
categories.comment: Public transportation in Helsinki is awesome but costs us about €100 a month.

categories.title: Car rent
categories.comment: Short car rents in Turkey and Serbia and regular rents in Helsinki to get to the local ski resorts.

categories.title: Taxi
categories.comment: Taxis to airports, around Istanbul, Antalya, Izmir, Belgrade, and Novi Sad. We almost don't use it in Helsinki.

categories.title: Health Insurance
categories.comment: Employer-sponsored super fancy insurance until August.

categories.title: Doctor visits
categories.comment: Mostly dentists.

categories.title: Pharmacy
categories.comment: Vitamins, ocassional and permanent medications.

categories.title: Entertainment
categories.comment: Toys, zoos and other entertainment for the kid. And tickets to Blink 182 next year!

categories.title: Education
categories.comment: Books, pre-daycare for the kid, yoga class for Missis.

categories.title: Sport
categories.comment: Wow! A lot of stuff here: new electric bike, new snowboard and boots, kid's snowboard and boots, skipasses to local resorts, gym membership, new dumbbells, kid's bikes, etc.

categories.title: Hobbies and arts
categories.comment: All hobbies this year were sport-related.

categories.title: Clothing
categories.comment: We bought a lot of clothes this year, and a large part was from thrift shops.

categories.title: Tech & Gadgets
categories.comment: Home appliances for the new apartment.

categories.title: Home stuff
categories.comment: This year we had to fill the apartment with furniture and stuff from scratch.

categories.title: Work supplies
categories.comment: The table and the monitor for the home office, temporary Macbook Air, and visa-related expenses.

categories.title: Household goods
categories.comment: We spent half of the year in Airbnb and hotels, so not that much in this category.

categories.title: Cell phone
categories.comment: My phone plan is now €30/month, and it includes unlimited data and calls. No other options, though.

categories.title: Subscriptions
categories.comment: Domain for this site.

categories.title: Personal
categories.comment: Beauty products mostly.

categories.title: Misc
categories.comment: Here go bureaucracy expenses (passports, apostilles, IDs, COVID tests), some stupid spending (missed flights, for example), etc. One interesting purchase here is the missis's study of her Jewish heritage. No heritage found at the moment :)

categories.title: Hotels
categories.comment: Pretty messy picture here in travel section. Here I counted only vacation-related hotels: Sochi mountains, Turkey two-week vacation, trips to Vladimir.

categories.title: Travel Transportation
categories.comment: But in this section, I counted all our long-distance transportation for this year, which I doubt my wife counts as travel.

categories.title: Travel Entertainment
categories.comment: Season ski-pass in Sochi mountains and snowboard lessons with the group.

categories.title: Food and other
categories.comment: Food for Sochi trips.

categories.title: Presents
categories.comment: Presents to friends and family.

categories.title: Parties hosting
categories.comment: All our birthdays were away from our loved ones. So, no parties this year.

categories.title: Charity
categories.comment: Nothing special here still.

categories.title: Taxes and fees
categories.comment: After moving to Finland, our taxes raised to almost 50%. But historically, I count here only after-tax income and spending.

categories.title: Fines
categories.comment: We've got a fine for the lack of a child seat in car-sharing.

categories.title: Investments
categories.comment: Dividend income from our portfolio.

categories.title: Paycheck
categories.comment: I joined Mapbox at the end of the year and received sweet sign-up bonus.

categories.title: Side hustle
categories.comment: Long-term relationships with an old client brought me new exciting opportunity.

categories.title: Interest
categories.comment: Miles and interest on the cash account

categories.title: Stuff sales
categories.comment: I sold all my woodwork stuff, since it didn't make sense to move it to the new place.

categories.title: Presents
categories.comment: Thanks to the family!

categories.title: Other
categories.comment: Stock options income from Yandex (though, it's only on paper, since it was blocked by EU), and my new employer's compensations for transportation and home office.
